channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: FABind+: Enhancing Molecular Docking through Improved Pocket Prediction and Pose Generation
item.description: Molecular docking is a pivotal process in drug discovery.

item.title: Enhancing Lithological Mapping with Spatially Constrained Bayesian Network (SCB-Net): An Approach for Field Data-Constrained Predictions with Uncertainty Evaluation
item.description: The SCB-Net aims to effectively exploit the information from auxiliary variables while producing spatially constrained predictions.

item.title: Unsolvable Problem Detection: Evaluating Trustworthiness of Vision Language Models
item.description: This paper introduces a novel and significant challenge for Vision Language Models (VLMs), termed Unsolvable Problem Detection (UPD).

item.title: MTLoRA: A Low-Rank Adaptation Approach for Efficient Multi-Task Learning
item.description: Adapting models pre-trained on large-scale datasets to a variety of downstream tasks is a common strategy in deep learning.

item.title: Towards a Framework for Evaluating Explanations in Automated Fact Verification
item.description: As deep neural models in NLP become more complex, and as a consequence opaque, the necessity to interpret them becomes greater.

item.title: Decision Mamba: Reinforcement Learning via Sequence Modeling with Selective State Spaces
item.description: Decision Transformer, a promising approach that applies Transformer architectures to reinforcement learning, relies on causal self-attention to model sequences of states, actions, and rewards.

item.title: NeSLAM: Neural Implicit Mapping and Self-Supervised Feature Tracking With Depth Completion and Denoising
item.description: Second, the occupancy scene representation is replaced with Signed Distance Field (SDF) hierarchical scene representation for high-quality reconstruction and view synthesis.

item.title: Automated Identification and Segmentation of Hi Sources in CRAFTS Using Deep Learning Method
item.description: We introduce a machine learning-based method for extracting HI sources from 3D spectral data, and construct a dedicated dataset of HI sources from CRAFTS.

item.title: Dual Simplex Volume Maximization for Simplex-Structured Matrix Factorization
item.description: Simplex-structured matrix factorization (SSMF) is a generalization of nonnegative matrix factorization, a fundamental interpretable data analysis model, and has applications in hyperspectral unmixing and topic modeling.

item.title: Video-Based Human Pose Regression via Decoupled Space-Time Aggregation
item.description: In light of this, we propose a novel Decoupled Space-Time Aggregation network (DSTA) to separately capture the spatial contexts between adjacent joints and the temporal cues of each individual joint, thereby avoiding the conflation of spatiotemporal dimensions.

item.title: SCINeRF: Neural Radiance Fields from a Snapshot Compressive Image
item.description: SCI is a cost-effective method that enables the recording of high-dimensional data, such as hyperspectral or temporal information, into a single image using low-cost 2D imaging sensors.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Transfer Robustness to Lower-Resource Languages on Adversarial Datasets
item.description: Multilingual Language Models (MLLMs) exhibit robust cross-lingual transfer capabilities, or the ability to leverage information acquired in a source language and apply it to a target language.

item.title: Structure Matters: Tackling the Semantic Discrepancy in Diffusion Models for Image Inpainting
item.description: Denoising diffusion probabilistic models for image inpainting aim to add the noise to the texture of image during the forward process and recover masked regions with unmasked ones of the texture via the reverse denoising process. Despite the meaningful semantics generation, the existing arts suffer from the semantic discrepancy between masked and unmasked regions, since the semantically dense unmasked texture fails to be completely degraded while the masked regions turn to the pure noise in diffusion process, leading to the large discrepancy between them. In this paper, we aim to answer how unmasked semantics guide texture denoising process;together with how to tackle the semantic discrepancy, to facilitate the consistent and meaningful semantics generation. To this end, we propose a novel structure-guided diffusion model named StrDiffusion, to reformulate the conventional texture denoising process under structure guidance to derive a simplified denoising objective for image inpainting, while revealing:1) the semantically sparse structure is beneficial to tackle semantic discrepancy in early stage, while dense texture generates reasonable semantics in late stage;2) the semantics from unmasked regions essentially offer the time-dependent structure guidance for the texture denoising process, benefiting from the time-dependent sparsity of the structure semantics. For the denoising process, a structure-guided neural network is trained to estimate the simplified denoising objective by exploiting the consistency of the denoised structure between masked and unmasked regions. Besides, we devise an adaptive resampling strategy as a formal criterion as whether structure is competent to guide the texture denoising process, while regulate their semantic correlations. Extensive experiments validate the merits of StrDiffusion over the state-of-the-arts. Our code is available at https://github. com/htyjers/StrDiffusion.

item.title: An Efficient Approach for Studying Cross-Lingual Transfer in Multilingual Language Models
item.description: The capacity and effectiveness of pre-trained multilingual models (MLMs) for zero-shot cross-lingual transfer is well established.

item.title: Mol-AIR: Molecular Reinforcement Learning with Adaptive Intrinsic Rewards for Goal-directed Molecular Generation
item.description: We believe that Mol-AIR represents a significant advancement in drug discovery, offering a more efficient path to discovering novel therapeutics.

item.title: ECLIPSE: Efficient Continual Learning in Panoptic Segmentation with Visual Prompt Tuning
item.description: Panoptic segmentation, combining semantic and instance segmentation, stands as a cutting-edge computer vision task.

item.title: U-VAP: User-specified Visual Appearance Personalization via Decoupled Self Augmentation
item.description: Extensive experiments on various kinds of visual attributes with SOTA personalization methods show the ability of the proposed method to mimic target visual appearance in novel contexts, thus improving the controllability and flexibility of personalization.

item.title: The Impact of Prompts on Zero-Shot Detection of AI-Generated Text
item.description: In this paper, we introduce an evaluative framework to empirically analyze the impact of prompts on the detection accuracy of AI-generated text.

item.title: Enhancing Dimension-Reduced Scatter Plots with Class and Feature Centroids
item.description: We illustrate the utility of this approach with data derived from the phenotypes of three neurogenetic diseases and demonstrate how the addition of class and feature centroids increases the interpretability of scatter plots.

item.title: UltraLight VM-UNet: Parallel Vision Mamba Significantly Reduces Parameters for Skin Lesion Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we deeply explore the key elements of parameter influence in Mamba and propose an UltraLight Vision Mamba UNet (UltraLight VM-UNet) based on this.

item.title: Shallow Cross-Encoders for Low-Latency Retrieval
item.description: However, Cross-Encoders based on large transformer models (such as BERT or T5) are computationally expensive and allow for scoring only a small number of documents within a reasonably small latency window.

item.title: Localising the Seizure Onset Zone from Single-Pulse Electrical Stimulation Responses with a Transformer
item.description: Secondly, we demonstrate the efficacy of the Transformer models in handling heterogeneous electrode placements, increasing the AUROC to 0. 730.

item.title: SeaBird: Segmentation in Bird's View with Dice Loss Improves Monocular 3D Detection of Large Objects
item.description: We argue that the cause of failure is the sensitivity of depth regression losses to noise of larger objects.

item.title: TFB: Towards Comprehensive and Fair Benchmarking of Time Series Forecasting Methods
item.description: Next, we employ TFB to perform a thorough evaluation of 21 Univariate Time Series Forecasting (UTSF) methods on 8, 068 univariate time series and 14 Multivariate Time Series Forecasting (MTSF) methods on 25 datasets.

item.title: Negative Label Guided OOD Detection with Pretrained Vision-Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel post hoc OOD detection method, called NegLabel, which takes a vast number of negative labels from extensive corpus databases.

item.title: Emotion-Anchored Contrastive Learning Framework for Emotion Recognition in Conversation
item.description: To achieve this, we utilize label encodings as anchors to guide the learning of utterance representations and design an auxiliary loss to ensure the effective separation of anchors for similar emotions.

item.title: Towards a Robust Retrieval-Based Summarization System
item.description: SummRAG is an example of our goal of defining structured methods to test the capabilities of an LLM, rather than addressing issues in a one-off fashion.

item.title: Efficient Modulation for Vision Networks
item.description: We demonstrate that the modulation mechanism is particularly well suited for efficient networks and further tailor the modulation design by proposing the efficient modulation (EfficientMod) block, which is considered the essential building block for our networks.

item.title: Benchmarking Counterfactual Image Generation
item.description: Counterfactual image generation is pivotal for understanding the causal relations of variables, with applications in interpretability and generation of unbiased synthetic data.

item.title: Voice Signal Processing for Machine Learning. The Case of Speaker Isolation
item.description: However, ML engineers who work on such tasks might not have a background in signal processing which is an entirely different area of expertise.

item.title: Learn "No" to Say "Yes" Better: Improving Vision-Language Models via Negations
item.description: Using CC-Neg along with modifications to the contrastive loss of CLIP, our proposed CoN-CLIP framework, has an improved understanding of negations.

item.title: Unsupervised Tumor-Aware Distillation for Multi-Modal Brain Image Translation
item.description: Existing methods suffer from the problem of brain tumor deformation during translation, as they fail to focus on the tumor areas when translating the whole images.

item.title: Embracing Unknown Step by Step: Towards Reliable Sparse Training in Real World
item.description: Sparse training has emerged as a promising method for resource-efficient deep neural networks (DNNs) in real-world applications.

item.title: Binarized Low-light Raw Video Enhancement
item.description: For the second issue, we present a distribution-aware binary convolution, which captures the distribution characteristics of real-valued input and incorporates them into plain binary convolutions to alleviate the degradation in performance.

item.title: Rewrite the Stars
item.description: Recent studies have drawn attention to the untapped potential of the "star operation" (element-wise multiplication) in network design.

item.title: KGUF: Simple Knowledge-aware Graph-based Recommender with User-based Semantic Features Filtering
item.description: The recent integration of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) into recommendation has led to a novel family of Collaborative Filtering (CF) approaches, namely Graph Collaborative Filtering (GCF).

item.title: Heterogeneous Network Based Contrastive Learning Method for PolSAR Land Cover Classification
item.description: Besides, this work has implications for how to efficiently utilize the multi-features of PolSAR data to learn better high-level representation in CL and how to construct networks suitable for PolSAR data better.

item.title: New Semantic Task for the French Spoken Language Understanding MEDIA Benchmark
item.description: A combination ofmultiple datasets, including the MEDIA dataset, was suggested for training this joint model.

item.title: An Interactive Human-Machine Learning Interface for Collecting and Learning from Complex Annotations
item.description: Human-Computer Interaction has been shown to lead to improvements in machine learning systems by boosting model performance, accelerating learning and building user confidence.

item.title: Detecting Financial Bots on the Ethereum Blockchain
item.description: In this study, we present a novel approach that utilizes machine learning for the detection of financial bots on the Ethereum platform.

item.title: Improving Clinical NLP Performance through Language Model-Generated Synthetic Clinical Data
item.description: Generative models have been showing potential for producing data in mass.

item.title: Human-compatible driving partners through data-regularized self-play reinforcement learning
item.description: Therefore, incorporating realistic human agents is essential for scalable training and evaluation of autonomous driving systems in simulation.

item.title: MoDiTalker: Motion-Disentangled Diffusion Model for High-Fidelity Talking Head Generation
item.description: AToM excels in capturing subtle lip movements by leveraging an audio attention mechanism.

item.title: JIST: Joint Image and Sequence Training for Sequential Visual Place Recognition
item.description: As a mitigation to this problem, we propose a novel Joint Image and Sequence Training protocol (JIST) that leverages large uncurated sets of images through a multi-task learning framework.

item.title: Model Stock: All we need is just a few fine-tuned models
item.description: This paper introduces an efficient fine-tuning method for large pre-trained models, offering strong in-distribution (ID) and out-of-distribution (OOD) performance.

item.title: Flexible Analysis of Individual Heterogeneity in Event Studies: Application to the Child Penalty
item.description: Third, we use the individual-level estimates as a regressor on the right-hand side to study the intergenerational elasticity of the CP between mothers and daughters.

item.title: Dataverse: Open-Source ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Pipeline for Large Language Models
item.description: To address the challenges associated with data processing at scale, we propose Dataverse, a unified open-source Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipeline for large language models (LLMs) with a user-friendly design at its core.

item.title: KazSAnDRA: Kazakh Sentiment Analysis Dataset of Reviews and Attitudes
item.description: This paper presents KazSAnDRA, a dataset developed for Kazakh sentiment analysis that is the first and largest publicly available dataset of its kind.

item.title: Debiasing Cardiac Imaging with Controlled Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: Notably, we conduct all our experiments using a single, consumer-level GPU to highlight the feasibility of our approach within resource-constrained environments.

item.title: X-MIC: Cross-Modal Instance Conditioning for Egocentric Action Generalization
item.description: Lately, there has been growing interest in adapting vision-language models (VLMs) to image and third-person video classification due to their success in zero-shot recognition.
